scholarships.title: Inlaks Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Outstanding academic record, personal integrity, leadership qualities and a commitment to succeed
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: KC Mahindra Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Academic merit, leadership qualities and a commitment to community service
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Rajiv Gandhi Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Academic merit, financial need and a commitment to community service
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Ashok Kumar Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Meritorious students from Rajasthan who have been admitted to a university abroad for postgraduate studies
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Fulbright-Nehru Master's Fellowship
scholarships.criteria: Meritorious Indian students who have been admitted to a university in the United States for a master's degree program
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Tata Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Indian students with financial need who have been admitted to Cornell University
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: KC Mahindra Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Academic merit, leadership qualities and a commitment to community service
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Goa Education Trust Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Meritorious students from Goa who have been admitted to a university abroad for postgraduate studies
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Ashok Kumar Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Meritorious students from Rajasthan who have been admitted to a university abroad for postgraduate studies
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Gopabandhu Sya Sahayata Yojana
scholarships.criteria: Students pursuing UG, PG or any course
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: KSCSTE Prathibha Scholarship Programme
scholarships.criteria: Top 10 rank holders in the engineering/medical entrance exam
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Post Matric Scholarships Scheme for ST Students
scholarships.criteria: ST students pursuing UG/PG/Technical & Vocational courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Post-Matric Scholarship for SC Students

scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Disha Scholarship Program for General Graduation Students
scholarships.criteria: SC students of Class 11 and above
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Post-Matric Scholarship for SEBC Students
scholarships.criteria: SEBC students pursuing UG/PG/Technical & Vocational courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Post-Matric Scholarship for EBC Students
scholarships.criteria: EBC students pursuing UG/PG/Technical & Vocational courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Post-Matric Scholarship for ST/SC/OBC/SEBC/EBC Communities
scholarships.criteria: Students studying at post-matriculation level from ST/SC/OBC/SEBC/EBC communities
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Summer Research Internship Program (SRIP)
scholarships.criteria: Students studying at postgraduate level in science and engineering
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: JN Tata Endowment Loan Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: For students across India for higher studies abroad
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.title: Post-Matric Scholarship for OBC, EBC and DNT Students
scholarships.criteria: OBC, EBC and DNT students of Sikkim studying at post-matriculation level
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Teach for India Fellowship
scholarships.criteria: Graduate students committed to teaching in low-income schools for two years
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.title: Post-Matric Scholarship for ST Students
scholarships.criteria: ST students studying at post-matriculation level
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Vocational Training Fee Reimbursement for ST Students
scholarships.criteria: ST students enrolled in vocational training courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Buddy4Study - IDFC FIRST Bank Education Loan Programme
scholarships.criteria: ST students enrolled in undergraduate or postgraduate courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Merit Scholarship for SC/ST/OBC Students
scholarships.criteria: Students studying in graduation or postgraduate courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Shree Maheshwari Foundation Higher Education Scholarships
scholarships.criteria: Students studying in graduation or postgraduate courses in commerce, arts, or management
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: West Bengal Talent Support Stipend Programme
scholarships.criteria: Students studying at post-matriculation level from minority communities
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Tuition Fees and Examination Fees to SBC Students
scholarships.criteria: SBC category students studying in graduation or postgraduate courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Kind Circle Scholarship for Meritorious Students
scholarships.criteria: Class 1 to PG students with academic merit
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.title: Post-Matric Scholarship for ST Students
scholarships.criteria: ST students studying at post-matriculation level
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Buddy Study CURSOS POR Study in India (Domestic) Education Loan - UG & PG
scholarships.criteria: Undergraduate and postgraduate students
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Successful applicants must meet a minimum academic standard, typically requiring a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Global Eligibility:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students of all nationalities, making it accessible to a diverse pool of applicants.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized educational institutions accredited by relevant authorities.

- Merit-Based Financial Assistance:
  - Financial support is awarded based on academic excellence, extracurricular achievements, leadership potential, and other relevant criteria.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - While age restrictions may be in place for some scholarships, others may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Post-Matric Scholarship for OBC Students
scholarships.criteria: OBC students studying in Class 11
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Tuition Fees and Examination Fees to OBC Students
scholarships.criteria: OBC students studying at post-matriculation level
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Education Concession to the Children of Ex-Servicemen
scholarships.criteria: Children/Wife/Widow of ex-servicemen studying at post-matriculation level
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Buddy4Study-Propelld Domestic Education Loan Programme
scholarships.criteria: Undergraduate and postgraduate students
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Telangana Post Matric Scholarship (PMS) for SC/ST/BC/Disabled Category
scholarships.criteria: Tuition fee reimbursement for SC/ST/BC/Disabled students from Class 10 to PhD level
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Post Matric Scholarship to SBC Students
scholarships.criteria: SBC students studying from Class 11 to postgraduate level
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Post-Matric Scholarship for SC Students
scholarships.criteria: SC students studying at post-matriculation level
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Government of Dr. Panjabrao Deshmukh Hostel Maintenance Allowance Scheme 2023-24
scholarships.criteria: Students pursuing medicine in postgraduate courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Education Concession to Children of Freedom Fighters
scholarships.criteria: Ward/Wife/Widow of freedom fighters studying at post-matriculation level
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Jawaharlal Nehru University Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: JNU students enrolled in UG or PG courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Admission fees of €22,000 and monthly maintenance allowance
scholarships.criteria: Open category students pursuing undergraduate or postgraduate courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: West Bengal Meri-cum-Means Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Minority students for pursuing undergraduate or postgraduate courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Government of India Post-Matric Scholarship for SC Students
scholarships.criteria: SC students studying in Class 11 and above
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Post-Matric Tuition Fee and Examination Fee (Freeship)
scholarships.criteria: Students studying in Class 11 and above
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Maintenance Allowance for SC Students in Professional Courses
scholarships.criteria: SC students pursuing professional courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Post-Matric Scholarship for ST Students
scholarships.criteria: ST students studying at post-matriculation level
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Karnataka Vidyasiri Scholarship Scheme
scholarships.criteria: Students belonging to SC/ST/OBC/Minority categories pursuing post-matric courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.title: Karnataka Minority Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Students belonging to Minority communities pursuing post-matric courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Karnataka ePass Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Students pursuing post-matric courses from economically backward backgrounds
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Karnataka Merit Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Merit-based scholarship for students excelling in academics
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.title: Karnataka Sports Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for talented athletes pursuing higher education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Karnataka Armed Forces Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for children of armed forces personnel pursuing higher education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Karnataka Entrepreneurship Development Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students pursuing entrepreneurship courses and initiatives
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Karnataka Environmental Science Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students studying environmental science and related fields
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.criteria: Support for students from tribal communities pursuing higher education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Karnataka Research Fellowship
scholarships.criteria: Fellowship for research scholars in science and technology disciplines
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Karnataka Skill Development Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students enrolled in skill development programs
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.title: Tamil Nadu Higher Education Special Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial assistance for economically backward students pursuing higher education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Tamil Nadu Meritorious Sports Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for outstanding sports achievers pursuing education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.title: Tamil Nadu Agriculture Innovation Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students involved in innovative agriculture projects
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Tamil Nadu Science and Technology Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students pursuing education in science and technology
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Tamil Nadu Performing Arts Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students excelling in performing arts
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Tamil Nadu Entrepreneurship Development Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial assistance for students pursuing entrepreneurship programs
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.
