scholarships.title: Tamil Nadu Literature and Journalism Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students excelling in literature and journalism
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Andhra Pradesh Economically Weaker Sections Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial assistance for students from economically weaker sections pursuing education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Andhra Pradesh Minority Education Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students belonging to minority communities pursuing post-matric courses
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Andhra Pradesh Tribal Development Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial support for students from tribal communities pursuing higher education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Andhra Pradesh Coastal Area Fisheries Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students studying fisheries in coastal areas
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Andhra Pradesh Skill Development Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students enrolled in skill development programs
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students studying information technology and related fields
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.title: Andhra Pradesh Green Energy Innovation Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students involved in innovative green energy projects
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Kerala Arts and Culture Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students excelling in arts and cultural activities
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Kerala Fishermen's Welfare Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial support for students from fishing communities pursuing education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Kerala Women in Technology Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for women pursuing education in technology and related fields
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Kerala Tribal Education Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial support for students from tribal communities pursuing education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.criteria: Support for students involved in innovative start-up projects
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional scholastic performance, typically by maintaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to International Applicants:
  - The scholarship opportunity welcomes applications from students of all nationalities and backgrounds.

- Acceptance into Accredited Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized educational institutions that meet the criteria specified by the scholarship provider.

- Merit-Based Financial Support:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on a combination of academic merit, extracurricular achievements, leadership qualities, and other relevant factors.

- No Strict Age Limitation:
  - While age restrictions may apply in some cases, many private scholarships have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Kerala Heritage Tourism Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students studying and promoting heritage tourism
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Goa Social Welfare Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial assistance for socially and economically disadvantaged students
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Goa Fisherfolk Welfare Scholarship

scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Goa Green Energy Innovation Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students involved in innovative green energy projects
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Goa Marine Biology Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students studying marine biology and related fields
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.title: Goa Start-up Innovation Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students involved in innovative start-up projects
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Goa Classical Dance and Music Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial assistance for students excelling in classical dance and music
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Rajasthan Social Welfare Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial assistance for socially and economically disadvantaged students
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Rajasthan Fisherfolk Welfare Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial support for students from fishing communities pursuing education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Rajasthan Green Energy Innovation Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students involved in innovative green energy projects
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Rajasthan Start-up Innovation Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students involved in innovative start-up projects
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Rajasthan Heritage Tourism Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students studying and promoting heritage tourism
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Telangana Social Welfare Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial assistance for socially and economically disadvantaged students
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Telangana Green Energy Innovation Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students involved in innovative green energy projects
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Telangana Women in Technology Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for women pursuing education in technology and related fields
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.eligibility_description:

  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Telangana Marine Biology Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students studying marine biology and related fields
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must have attained a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Criteria:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals holding valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited Indian educational institutions recognized by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Need:
  - Financial assistance is available to eligible candidates based on demonstrated financial need. Applicants must provide documented evidence of their financial circumstances.

- Age Limitation:
  - Applicants should fall within the age bracket specified by the scholarship program, typically between 18 to 35 years.

scholarships.title: Telangana Heritage Tourism Scholarship

scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.title: Delhi Arts and Culture Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students excelling in arts and cultural activities
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Delhi Fisherfolk Welfare Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial support for students from fishing communities pursuing education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Delhi Women in Technology Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for women pursuing education in technology and related fields
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.eligibility_description:
Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional scholastic performance, typically by maintaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to International Applicants:
  - The scholarship opportunity welcomes applications from students of all nationalities and backgrounds.

- Acceptance into Accredited Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized educational institutions that meet the criteria specified by the scholarship provider.

- Merit-Based Financial Support:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on a combination of academic merit, extracurricular achievements, leadership qualities, and other relevant factors.

- No Strict Age Limitation:
  - While age restrictions may apply in some cases, many private scholarships have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Delhi Start-up Innovation Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students involved in innovative start-up projects
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Madhya Pradesh Social Welfare Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial assistance for socially and economically disadvantaged students
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Madhya Pradesh Green Energy Innovation Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students involved in innovative green energy projects
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Madhya Pradesh Marine Biology Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students studying marine biology and related fields
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.title: Madhya Pradesh Heritage Tourism Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students studying and promoting heritage tourism
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Punjab Arts and Culture Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students excelling in arts and cultural activities
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Minimum Academic Standard:
  - Eligible candidates are required to meet a minimum academic standard, with a CGPA of 6.5 or higher in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Verification:
  - The scholarship opportunity is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within the country.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions accredited by the Government of India for graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment Process:
  - Financial assistance is allocated based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to provide comprehensive documentation supporting their financial circumstances.

scholarships.title: Punjab Fisherfolk Welfare Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial support for students from fishing communities pursuing education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Educational Achievement Requirement:
  - Eligible candidates must have demonstrated exceptional academic performance, achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Status:
  - The scholarship is exclusively available to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status in India.

- Enrollment in Approved Institutions:
  - Applicants must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate studies.

- Financial Need Assessment:
  - Financial assistance is provided based on the demonstrated financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must furnish comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Limit:
  - Candidates should meet the age criteria stipulated by the scholarship program, typically within the specified age range.

scholarships.title: Punjab Women in Technology Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for women pursuing education in technology and related fields
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Punjab Minority Community Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Financial support for students from minority communities pursuing education
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Performance Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have demonstrated academic excellence by achieving a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Requirement:
  - Only Indian citizens or individuals with valid residency status in India are eligible to apply for the scholarship.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions approved by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants are required to submit comprehensive information regarding their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility:
  - Applicants should adhere to the age criteria specified by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Punjab Start-up Innovation Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Support for students involved in innovative start-up projects
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.

scholarships.title: Punjab Heritage Tourism Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Scholarship for students studying and promoting heritage tourism
scholarships.eligibility_description:
Academic Excellence Requirement:
  - Candidates must demonstrate outstanding academic performance, typically by achieving a minimum Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 6.5 or equivalent in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Open to All Nationalities:
  - The scholarship opportunity is open to students from all nationalities and residency statuses.

- Enrollment in Recognized Institutions:
  - Applicants should be enrolled or accepted into accredited educational institutions for graduate studies.

- Financial Assistance Based on Merit:
  - Financial assistance may be awarded based on academic merit, extracurricular achievements, and other factors, rather than solely on financial need.

- Flexible Age Requirements:
  - Age restrictions, if any, may vary depending on the scholarship program. Some scholarships may have flexible age criteria or none at all.

scholarships.title: Inlaks Scholarship
scholarships.criteria: Outstanding academic record, personal integrity, leadership qualities and a commitment to succeed
scholarships.eligibility_description:
- Scholastic Achievement Criteria:
  - Successful applicants must have exhibited exceptional scholastic performance, attaining a minimum CGPA of 6.5 in both their 10th and 12th-grade examinations.

- Citizenship and Residency Validation:
  - Eligibility is restricted to Indian citizens or individuals possessing valid residency status within India.

- Enrollment in Accredited Institutions:
  - Candidates must be enrolled or accepted into recognized Indian educational institutions endorsed by the Government of India for pursuing graduate-level studies.

- Financial Assistance Determination Process:
  - Financial assistance is awarded based on the documented financial need of eligible candidates. Applicants must submit comprehensive documentation substantiating their financial circumstances.

- Age Eligibility Criterion:
  - Applicants should satisfy the age criteria prescribed by the scholarship program, typically falling within the designated age range.
